<def-root>A <fen>Speaker</fen> expresses a polarized opinion, made of a <fen>Polarity</fen> and a <fen>Content</fen> or a <fen>Side</fen>. Alternatively a <fen>Topic</fen> can be expressed on which it is understood that the Speaker expresses the polarized opinion.
<ex></ex> Note that this frame covers cases in which it can be understood from the context that the polarized opinion corresponds to an authoritative decision, but contrary to the FR_Expressing_decision frame, this is undestood compositionnaly and not because of the construction or the LU.
<ex></ex>
Distinctions with other frames:
<ex></ex> ≠ <frframe>FR_Taking_sides</frframe> : Contrary to FR_Expressing_side, the LUs of FR_Taking_sides do incorporate the positive or negative polarity. <ex></ex>
≠ <frframe>Complaining</frframe>: Complaining's LUs polarity is always negative, and always implied by the LU itself, whereas FR_Expressing_side LUs can express either a positive or negative point of view, depending on the Polarity role filler which is expressed separately from the LU. <ex> </ex>
<asf>Relation to fndata-1.5</asf> : New frame, created for asfalda. </def-root>
<def-root> the <fen>Polarity</fen> is whether the Speaker is in favor or against the Content or Side. It is expressed by a preposition that is subcategorized, but whose meaning is not totally empty. <ex>FR-EX: <fex name="Speaker">Les électeurs</fex> <t>se sont prononcés</t> <fex name="Polarity">en faveur de</fex> la nationalisation.</ex> </def-root>
<def-root><fen>Content</fen> is what the Speaker expresses to be against or in favor of. <ex>FR-EX: <fex name="Speaker">Les électeurs</fex> <t>se sont prononcés</t> en faveur de <fex name="Content">la nationalisation</fex>.</ex> </def-root>
<def-root><fen>Side</fen> is the entity that the Speaker agrees or disagrees with. <ex>FR-EX: <fex name="Speaker">Les électeurs</fex> <t>se sont prononcés</t> en faveur de <fex name="Side">ce candidat</fex>.</ex> </def-root>
<def-root>The individual or body that expresses the polarized opinion, causing it to become binding in a jurisdiction represented by the <fen>Speaker</fen>. <ex>FR-EX: <fex name="Speaker">Les électeurs</fex> <t>se prononceront</t> sur le traité.</ex> </def-root>
<def-root>The <fen>Topic</fen> that the <fen>Speaker</fen> provides a polarized opinion about. <ex>FR-EX: <fex name="Speaker">Les électeurs</fex> <t>se prononceront</t> sur <fex name="Topic">le traité</fex>.</ex> </def-root>
